name: tinyauth
description: TinyAuth is a self-hosted authentication and authorization service that manages users, roles, and tokens. It exposes a simple admin web UI and APIs to integrate authentication into other services.
features: User management: Create and manage user accounts with passwords, profiles, and metadata.
Role-based access: Define roles and permissions to control access to resources and features.
Token generation: Issue JWT or API tokens for authenticating users in other applications.
Admin interface: Manage users, roles, and settings through a straightforward web administration panel.
API integration: Integrate authentication into other services using REST API endpoints.
OAuth support: Provide OAuth2 authentication for third-party applications and services.
Session management: Track active sessions and provide logout functionality across applications.
Password policies: Enforce password complexity requirements and expiration policies for security.
Multi-factor auth: Add an extra layer of security with optional two-factor authentication support.
Audit logging: Track authentication events and administrative actions for security monitoring.
Lightweight: Run with minimal resource requirements suitable for small to medium deployments.
Self-contained: Deploy as a standalone service without complex dependencies or infrastructure.
